messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] TCS/NCP?
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/29/2005 9:36:07 AM Mountain Daylight Time, mlam@iGlide.net writes: Ummm . .  . . I missed some posts so just wondering - what s TCS and
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/29/2005 9:36:07 AM Mountain Daylight Time,
mlam@... writes:

Ummm . . . . I missed some posts so just wondering - what's TCS and NCP?



==========

All the posts are in the archives:
_http://groups.yahoo.com/group/UnschoolingDiscussion/_
(http://groups.yahoo.com/group/UnschoolingDiscussion/)

Google has links for TCS and NCP, I bet.

_http://www.google.com/search?hl=en&ie=ISO-8859-1&q=TCS+NCP_
(http://www.google.com/search?hl=en&ie=ISO-8859-1&q=TCS+NCP)

TCS stands for "Taking Children Seriously":
_http://www.takingchildrenseriously.com/_
(http://www.takingchildrenseriously.com/)

NCP for Non-Coercive Parenting. DIdn't find a single best website, but try
google if you want to read more.

Sandra




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] TCS/NCP?
messages.msgSnippet: ***I missed some posts so just wondering - what s TCS and NCP?*** You can Google TCS and NCP and find a lot of information. TCS is *Taking Children Seriously*
messages.messageBody:
***I missed some posts so just wondering - what's TCS and NCP?***

You can Google TCS and NCP and find a lot of information.

TCS is *Taking Children Seriously* their website:
http://www.takingchildrenseriously.com/


NCP is *Non Coercive Parenting* and you can read about it at the
Autonomous Child website: http://www.autonomouschild.co.uk/

Deb L
